entry.title: MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 1 - Shell
entry.content:
• MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 1
    • what is shell
    • bash

MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 1

shell

what is shell

å‘½ä»¤è¡Œå·¥å…·ï¼ŒåŸºäºæ–‡æœ¬å·¥å…·
windows: powershell
linux: bash ( bourne again shellï¼‰

bash

å‘½ä»¤è¡Œæç¤ºç¬¦ ( shell prompt)

  • date ( date and time)

å¸¦å‚æ•° ( arguments) æ‰§è¡Œç¨‹åº

  • echo ( print the arguments you give it)
$ echo hello
hello

å‚æ•°éœ€è¦ç©ºæ ¼ ( white space)åˆ†å¼€
å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ç”¨"" or ''
å•è½¬ä¹‰ç”¨\

$ echo "hello world"
hello world
$ echo hello\ world
hello world
  • mkdir ( make directory)

å†…åµŒç¨‹åºä½äºç³»ç»Ÿæ–‡ä»¶ ( system file)
æœç´¢å€ŸåŠ©ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ ( environment variable)ä¸­ PATHå˜é‡ ( PATH variable)

$ echo $PATH
  • which ( to find which it actully runs)
$ which echo

PATH:
linux/macos: /
under root/
windows:
one root for every partition
absolute path/ relative path

  • pwd ( print working directory)
$ pwd
  • cd ( change directory)
$ cd /home
  • . ( the current directory)
  • .. ( the parent directory)

write a program please give a absolute pathğŸ˜€

è¿è¡Œç¨‹åºé»˜è®¤å½“å‰ç›®å½•

  • ls ( list the files in the current directory)
$ ls
  • ~ ( direct to the home directory)
  • cd - ( cd the dirctory you were previously in)

ç¨‹åºæœ‰æ ‡å¿— ( flag)å’Œé€‰é¡¹ ( option)ä½œä¸ºå‚æ•°ï¼Œä»¥-å¼€å¤´

  • --help
$ ls --help
  • -l ( give you more information)
$ ls -l

ls -lçš„åˆ—è¡¨ï¼š
3ä¸ªå­—æ¯ä¸€ç»„
å½“å‰ç”¨æˆ·æƒé™ | å½“å‰ç”¨æˆ·ç»„æƒé™ | å…¶ä»–äººæƒé™
read | write | execute
for flie: read ( read it), write ( save, add more, replace), execute ( run it)
for directory: read( list for the directory), write ( rename, create, remove file), execute( enter the dierctory)
(detele flie need the write for the directory)

  • mv ( rename file) ( change or move)
$ mv a.cpp b.cpp
$ mv a.cpp /b.cpp
  • cp ( copy)
$ cp a.cpp /b.cpp
  • rm ( remove) ( can not remove directory)
$ rm a.cpp
$ rm -r /dir ( to remove all files under the directory)
  • rmdir ( remove empty directory)
$ rmdir /dir
  • mkdir ( create a directory)
$ mkdir /a

  • crtl+c ( cancel)

  • man ( manul pages) (æŒ‰qé€€å‡º)

$ man ls
  • ctrl+l ( æ¸…ç©ºç»ˆç«¯)

æµ: < in > out >> add

$ echo hello > hello.out
  • cat ( show the file)
$ cat hello.in
$ cat < hello.in > hello.out
$ cat hello.out
$ cat <hello,in >> hello.out
$ cat hello.out
  • pipe:| ( take the output of the left program to and make the input of the right program)
$ a | b
  • tail ( print the last line)
$ tail -n1 ( print the last one line)

$ ls -l / | tail -n1> ls.txt
  • sudo ( super user: root)
  • sysfs ()
$ cd /sys

$ sudo su ( use root to run shell)
# ...
  • tee ( write to the file and shell)
$ tee < hello > hello.out

$ echo 500 | sudo tee brightness

  • xdg-open ( use right sofrware to open a file)

  • touch ( change the time of the file) ( usually use it to create a new file)

$ touch a.cpp
  • chmod ( change the permission)
u - user
g - group
o - other
+/-
rwx

$ chmod ug+rw a.cpp
